title: Incorrect size of the object when saved file is opened

content.raw:
There is a problem with saving a model in gazebo 2.2.3 (gazebo with ROS). This problem is similar to [this issue](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1567/incorrect-visual-geom-size-when-saving-a) which was resolved in higher gazebo version. 

steps to reproduce:

1\. open an empty world:  
```
#!c++

roslaunch turtlebot_gazebo turtlebot_world.launch world_file:=/opt/ros/indigo/share/turtlebot_gazebo/worlds/empty.world
```
2\. insert a box

3\. scale box in x, y, z axes

4\. save world, e.g. box.world

5\. close gazebo

6\. open a box.world

There are two problems:

1. width, length and height are default (1 meter).

2. the box is situated over the floor ![Gazebo_011.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3619868568-Gazebo_011.png)

There is a problem with saving a model in gazebo 2.2.3 (gazebo with ROS). This problem is similar to this issue which was resolved in higher gazebo version.

steps to reproduce:

1. open an empty world: 

roslaunch turtlebot_gazebo turtlebot_world.launch world_file:=/opt/ros/indigo/share/turtlebot_gazebo/worlds/empty.world

2. insert a box

3. scale box in x, y, z axes

4. save world, e.g. box.world

5. close gazebo

6. open a box.world

There are two problems:

  1. width, length and height are default (1 meter).

  2. the box is situated over the floor
